articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Some senior U.S. officials told Secretary of State Antony Blinken that they do not find "credible or reliable" Israel's assurances that it is using U.S.-supplied weapons in accordance with international humanitarian law.
articles.title: Exclusive: Some US officials say in internal memo Israel may be violating international law in Gaza

articles.author: Brad Brooks
articles.description: Pro-Palestinian protesters were arrested on a handful of U.S. university campuses on Saturday, as activists vowed to keep up the movement seeking a ceasefire in Israel's war with Hamas among other demands.
articles.title: Police arrest scores of pro-Palestinian protesters on US university campuses

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia attacked Ukrainian energy facilities in three regions on Saturday, damaging equipment and injuring at least one energy worker, Ukrainian Energy Minister German Galushchenko said.
articles.title: Russia hits Ukrainian energy facilities in three regions, Kyiv says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said a Russian attack on his country's energy sector on Saturday had targeted gas facilities important for supply to the European Union.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says Russia targeted gas facilities that secure EU supply

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Haiti's transition council on Saturday said it will vote for the country's next president on Tuesday as part of efforts to bring the Caribbean country under control amid rampant gang violence.
articles.title: Haiti transitional government to vote for president on Tuesday

articles.author: Sergio Goncalves
articles.description: Portugal's government said on Saturday it refuses to initiate any process to pay reparations for atrocities committed during transatlantic slavery and the colonial era, contrary to earlier comments from President Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa.
articles.title: Portugal's government rejects paying reparations for colonial, slavery legacy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iraq's parliament passed a law criminalising same-sex relationships with a maximum 15-year prison sentence on Saturday, in a move it said aimed to uphold religious values but was condemned by rights advocates as the latest attack on the LGBT community in Iraq.
articles.title: Iraq criminalises same-sex relationships with maximum 15 years in prison

articles.author: John Irish
articles.description: France's foreign minister will push proposals to prevent further escalation and a potential war between Israel and Iran-backed Hezbollah during a visit to Lebanon on Sunday as Paris seeks to refine a roadmap that both sides could accept to ease tensions.
articles.title: France's foreign minister looks to prevent Israel-Hezbollah conflict escalation in Lebanon visit

articles.author: Thomas Escritt
articles.description: Buffeted by sliding poll ratings and reeling from allegations that it had harboured a Chinese spy in its ranks, Germany's far-right Alternative for Germany sought to recover lost momentum at the Saturday launch of its campaign for June's European Parliament elections.
articles.title: Rocked by spy scandal, Germany's far-right reprises old themes at campaign launch

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three police officers were killed on Saturday in southern Chile during what President Gabriel Boric called a cowardly attack that led him to declare three days of national mourning.
articles.title: Chile's President Boric declares national mourning period after 3 police officers killed
